intro: Romulea collina, commonly known as the spring bellflower, is a perennial bulbous plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces a cluster of small, grass-like leaves and has a compact growth habit. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Romulea collina is valued in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to bloom early in the spring.
